thread.title_full: MC launches fogging drive - The Tribune

author: Tribune News Service
title: MC launches fogging drive - The Tribune
text:
MC launches fogging drive
To prevent the spread of mosquito-borne diseases such as dengue and malaria, the Municipal Corporation (MC) has initiated a fogging drive across all wards. Mayor Jatinder Singh Moti Bhatia said fogging would be conducted regularly to ensure the well-being of residents.
The drive has been proven effective in reducing mosquito population and minimising the risk of disease transmission.
By making fogging a regular feature, the corporation aims to create a safer environment for its residents, he said, adding that the proactive step demonstrates the MCâ€™s commitment to protecting public health, particularly during these months.
Vector-borne diseases such as dengue and malaria are a significant threat to human health and there is a need to take preventive measures.
